Description: Part of neck and body of translucent white and yellow-brown calcite jar with banding cut horizontally: an Egyptian vessel with part of engraved trilingual or quadrilingual cuneiform inscription in Old Persian, Elamite and Babylonian; exterior polished.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Susa, Found in the northern part of the citadel mound.
Bibliographic references: Searight, Reade & Finkel 2008a / Assyrian Stone Vessels and related material in the British Museum (273, p.33, fig.16)
Guide 1900a / A Guide to the Babylonian and Assyrian Antiquities (p.100)
Curtis & Tallis 2005 / Forgotten Empire: The world of Ancient Persia (cat. 142, p. 129)
Curtis 1993a / William Kennett Loftus and his excavations at Susa (E.79, p.27, pls.11b (lower right) and 19a)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006 7 Mar-11 Jun, Barcelona, Fundacion La Caixa, 'L'imperi Oblidat' 2005-2006 Sept-Jan, London, BM, 'Forgotten Empire' 1995-2005, 17 Nov-Dec, BM, G52/IRAN/8, no.8. Persian Room, wall-case [WC] 15, top shelf. Babylonian & Assyrian Room, wall-cases 28-29 (1900 Guide)
Condition: Fair; incomplete; part of neck and body only.
